frmappuse="1">Commentary</a></li></ul><button class="hidden" count="0"><div class="hamburger"><i></i></div><ul class="hidden-links hidden" style="right: itemtype="https://schema.org/BreadcrumbList" itemscope=""><li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement"><a href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/" itemtype="https://schema.org/ListItem" itemprop="itemListElement"><a href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city" itemprop="item" data-ga="ATF_breadcrumb|City News|" ga4data="[object Object]" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata" itemprop="item" data-ga="ATF_breadcrumb|kolkata News|" ga4data="[object Object]" frmappuse="1"><span itemprop="name">kolkata News</span></a><meta content="3" itemprop="position"></li><li><span>Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: RG Kar hospital ex-principal Ghosh, police officer sent to CBI custody till September 17</span></li></ul></div></div><div class="X9K5N Zapsu UbCNr false" data-scrollga="scroll#scroll_starts"><div class="VbXWj"><div class="sE5l5"><div class="yhwZO"><span>THE TIMES OF INDIA | </span>Sep 15, 2024, 23:29:59 IST<time datetime="2024-09-15T23:29:59+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-15T23:29:59+05:30"></div></div><div class="xAhTn"><div data-socialshare="113276298" class="tp_widget_as"></div><div class="PWTFz icon_share_wrap"><div class="jtkPl"><i class="iJ8io "></i><span>Share</span></div></div><div class="undefined LNgyX"><a href="https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMM6y_Qowwu70Ag" target="_blank" rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" frmappuse="1">Follow us <i></i></a></div></div></div><h1>Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: RG Kar hospital ex-principal Ghosh, police officer sent to CBI custody till September 17</h1><div class="art_synopsis lbg_synopsis"><div data-type="in_view" class="  "><div class="tCKCr  id-r-synopsis"><div class="faiOF"><div class="WEwSo"><div class="M1rHh undefined" data-ua-type="1" onclick="stpPgtnAndPrvntDefault(event)">West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is set to hold a meeting with a delegation of junior doctors at her residence later today. <br> <br> Post Banerjee's visit to the protest site, the junior doctors wrote to the CM calling a welcome move and a "goodwill gesture." They also asked for another meeting in order to resolve the impasse between the state and the protesting medics. <br> <br> Earlier today, Mamata Banerjee visited site outside Swasthya Bhawan in Salt Lake where junior doctors have been agitating. <br> <br> Despite Mamata's arrival, chants for justice persisted at the protest site. The chief minister, holding the microphone for several minutes, struggled to begin her speech amid the ongoing chaos. She has been requesting permission to address the crowd. <br> <br> I have come forward by leading the student movement, I have also struggled a lot in my life, I understand your struggle. I am not worried about my position. It rained all night yesterday, you were sitting here protesting, I was worried all night. After listening to your demands, I will study them. I do not run the government alone, I will definitely find a solution by studying your demands with senior officials. Whoever is found guilty will definitely be punished. I am asking for some time from you. The state government will not take any action against you (protesting doctors). I request you to return to work. All the work related to the development, infrastructure, security of the hospital has been started and will be done further: CM Mamata Banerjee. Stay with TOI for latest updates.</div><span class="bVjCU ">Read More</span></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class=""><div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">23:29 (IST) Sep 15<time datetime="2024-09-15T23:29:58+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-15T23:29:58+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post1"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Rift between protesting doctors, claims TMC leader Kunal Ghosh</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">TMC leader Kunal Ghosh said that there is a division among the junior doctors protesting in Kolkata. He posted an audio clip of an alleged conversation between the doctors and stated that while one group is seeking a resolution, another group wants to continue the disturbance.<br><br>"From the audio clip, it is clear that one section of the doctors wants a solution whereas the other section wants the disturbance to continue, this is an indication that taking a predetermined decision, one section wants a solution and another does not. So when Mamata Banerjee came out of the house, she asked them with folded hands to participate in the meeting, she said that it had been three hours, you come into the house and talk, but they did not agree," said Ghosh.<br></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113373154"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">20:13 (IST) Sep 15<time datetime="2024-09-15T20:13:18+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-15T20:13:18+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post2"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Doctors take out protest march demanding justice for RG Kar victim</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">A day after their proposed talks with West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to resolve the impasse over the RG Kar issue fell through, agitating junior doctors on Sunday took out a mega protest march in Salt Lake area demanding justice for the victim. Holding placards with slogans such as 'Arji noi dabi kor' (don't request but demand), hundreds of agitators drenched in rain marched from Central Park to Swasthya Bhawan, the headquarters of the state health department, where they have been staging a sit-in for the last six days.<br><br>They also raised demands for the resignation of Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Goyal, West Bengal health secretary and other officials.<br></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113370966"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">19:48 (IST) Sep 15<time datetime="2024-09-15T19:48:44+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-15T19:48:44+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post3"><p class="liveblogtextlist">RG Kar hospital ex-principal, police officer sent to CBI custody till September 17 in Kolkata rape-murder case</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p><p class="liveblogtextlist">A local court in Kolkata on Sunday remanded former RG Kar hospital principal Sandip Ghosh and Tala police station officer-in-charge Abhijit Mondal to CBI custody until September 17. The central agency had produced both individuals before the court in connection to the rape and murder of a doctor at the state-run hospital. </p><a href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/rg-kar-hospital-ex-principal-police-office-sent-to-cbi-custody-till-september-17-in-kolkata-rape-murder-case/articleshow/113370566.cms" index="3" frmappuse="1">Read more</a></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113370710"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">15:47 (IST) Sep 15<time datetime="2024-09-15T15:47:10+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-15T15:47:10+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post4"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata doctor rape-murder case: Sandip Ghosh and Abhijit Mandal sent to police custody till September 17</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Ghosh is already under judicial over financial irregularities case regarding RG Kar Hospital. He is additionally charged with tampering with evidence along with Mandal.</p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113367095"></i></div></div></div><div class="sRMSV xQT12 " data-scrollga="scroll#ad_view_5"><div class="ad_spacing"><div id="div-gpt-ad-mid1-dbf0ceae47" class="trc_related_container class="fshNz">22:38 (IST) Sep 14<time datetime="2024-09-14T22:38:30+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-14T22:38:30+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post5"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: It seems government is not serious about talks to resolve RG Kar impasse, said the agitating doctors</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">This came after the talks that were scheduled to be held between Mamata and the doctors failed again over disagreements regarding live streaming and recording the meet.</p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113355092"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">22:14 (IST) Sep 14<time datetime="2024-09-14T22:14:18+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-14T22:14:18+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post7"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: Imagine, snubbing protesting junior doctors, who came all the way to her residence, to resolve stalemate, BJP slams Mamata</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">"She is feeling slighted because the Junior Doctors are demanding transparency and didnt give in, despite wait of a few hours. Just think about the parents of RG Kar MCH rape and murder victims parents, who were made to wait for hours to see their dead daughters face. What about 840 hours of Junior Doctors? Why can't Mamata Banerjee agree to a live telecast or at least a two-way video recording? What is the logic of providing the recording two days later? The Supreme Court is to hear the matter four days later. Hence, the logic that the matter is subjudice is a hogwash. What is the WB Govt planning to do with the video?" Amit Malviya said in a post on X.<br><br>"Mamata Banerjee claims that some people are playing politics. Really? Isn't it true that a journalist (who holds a position in WB Govt while serving as editor of a channel) was sent to mediate? The acting DGP of West Bengal Police was constantly confabulating with him to steer the situation. What was he doing in the negotiations, if not politicking? Isn't it true that some ultra Left elements, who are agents of the TMC, held meeting with a political consulting firm, working for the TMC? Isn't it true that they were given the task of seeding division in the ranks of protesting doctors? Isn't this ultra Left gang the same people, who are scribbling and damaging walls of BJPs State HQ, just 50 meters away from the doctors protest site? The Junior Doctors must be cautious of the Trojan horses planted by the TMC. They might come in the garb of being kind and considerate senior Leftists but are paid agents of the TMC," he added.<br></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113354868"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">21:51 (IST) Sep 14<time datetime="2024-09-14T21:51:50+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-14T21:51:50+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post8"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: CBI arrests Sandip Ghosh and a policeman in rape-murder case of medic</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Ghosh is already under judicial over financial irregularities case regarding RG Kar Hospital.</p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113354585"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">21:48 (IST) Sep 14<time datetime="2024-09-14T21:48:35+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-14T21:48:35+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post9"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: MOS Chandrima Bhattacharya said it was too late and no meeting was possible now, a doctor said after talk fails</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">We are ready to sit anywhere and had demanded transparency. We asked for live streaming. When they said it was not possible. We asked both parties to video record the meeting to which they denied. They said they would record the video and would provide it to us only after the SC permission. The CM asked us to come inside and have tea. We had a meeting among ourselves and decided meet them without video recording and were ready to only have the minutes. But when we went there to inform the same to them, then MOS Chandrima Bhattacharya said it was too late and no meeting was possible now. And the MOS left soon, he said.</p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113354540"></i></div></div></div><div class="faZag xQT12 " data-scrollga="scroll#ad_view_11"><div class="ctn-workaround-div clearfix"><div id="div-clmb-ctn-341148-195364060" data-slot="341148" data-position="195364060" class="colombiaSuccess ctn-colombia" style="display: block; width: 100%; margin: 0px auto 5px;"><iframe id="^ifr_341148-195364060" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" title="3rd party ad content" style="width: 100%; border: 0px; overflow: hidden; aspect-ratio: 16 / 9; height: 100%;"></iframe></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">21:38 (IST) Sep 14<time datetime="2024-09-14T21:38:48+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-14T21:38:48+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post11"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: Meeting called off, doctors leave in tears, 'disappointed'</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">We wanted the meeting to happen and had moved away from all our demands. But they asked us to leave and even threatened that if we dont leave they will force us out. They said they couldnt wait for three hours while we had been waiting for 35 days. It means this is what they had planned. We had faith in the CM but this is what we received in return. We are disappointed, said a protesting doctor.</p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113354389"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">21:27 (IST) Sep 14<time datetime="2024-09-14T21:27:45+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-14T21:27:45+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post12"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: Chief secretary Manoj Pant and other officials leave from the residence of CM Mamata Banerjee after meet</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">The junior doctors had demanded live streaming of the meeting. The CM said it couldn't be allowed as the matter was under sub-judice.</p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113354300"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">21:10 (IST) Sep 14<time datetime="2024-09-14T21:10:04+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-14T21:10:04+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post14"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case Live Updates: 'At least have some tea,' Mamata Banerjee requests doctors to come inside her house</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p class="liveblogtextlist">"15 of you were supposed to come here but 40 of you have come here. class="ABTnG"></i><div class="SceF4"><p>I have come forward by leading the student movement, I have also struggled a lot in my life, I understand your struggle. I am not worried about my position. It rained all night yesterday, you were sitting here protesting, I was worried all night. After listening to your demands, I will study them. I do not run the government alone, I will definitely find a solution by studying your demands with senior officials. Whoever is found guilty will definitely be punished. I am asking for some time from you. The state government will not take any action against you (protesting doctors). I request you to return to work. Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. "Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us," they wrote. One of the agitating doctors, Aniket Mahato, said that the letter was drafted earlier this month and sent on Thursday night.<br></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113320838"></i></div></div></div><div class="faZag xQT12 " data-scrollga="scroll#ad_view_52"><div class="ctn-workaround-div clearfix"><div id="div-clmb-ctn-341148-124150358" data-slot="341148" data-position="124150358" class="colombia  "></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">14:24 (IST) Sep 13<time datetime="2024-09-13T14:24:55+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-13T14:24:55+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post52"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Fissures in medical community over CM Mamata Banerjee meet cancellation</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p><p class="liveblogtextlist">The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago. Roy, lodged at Presidency Correctional Home, was again questioned on Wednesday for three-and-a-half hours. </p><a href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/kolkata-pgt-doctor-rape-murder-case-cbi-collects-sanjay-roys-dental-impression-mouth-swab/articleshow/113302576.cms" index="59" frmappuse="1">Read more</a></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113310247"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">08:35 (IST) Sep 13<time datetime="2024-09-13T08:35:36+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-13T08:35:36+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post60"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Lawyer of accused Sanjay Roy questions autopsy</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p><p class="liveblogtextlist">Sanjay Roy's lawyer Kabita Sarkar, who has expressed doubts over the post-mortem process of the RG Kar victim, is likely to question in court the process of the autopsy and preservation of fluids retrieved by the police. Roy is the only person, who has so far been arrested for the rape and murder of the RG Kar doctor. </p><a href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/kolkata-doctor-case-lawyer-of-accused-sanjay-roy-questions-autopsy/articleshow/113302660.cms" index="60" frmappuse="1">Read more</a></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113308251"></i></div></div></div><div class="faZag xQT12 " data-scrollga="scroll#ad_view_62"><div class="ctn-workaround-div clearfix"><div id="div-clmb-ctn-341148-190022092" data-slot="341148" data-position="190022092" class="colombia  "></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">08:23 (IST) Sep 13<time datetime="2024-09-13T08:23:53+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-13T08:23:53+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post62"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Junior doctors hold a protest for third night in a row at Swasthya Bhawan in Kolkata's Salt Lake area</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><div class="cdatainfo   id-r-component " data-pos="0"><div data-type="twitter" data-handle="ANI" data-handlename="ANI" data-favoritecount="0" data-retweetcount="0" data-id="1834323646867013919"><div><div class="twitter-tweet twitter-tweet-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 550px; width: 100%; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-3" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="X Post" src="https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?dnt=false&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-3&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideCard=false&amp;hideThread=false&amp;id=1834323646867013919&amp;lang=en&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com%2Fcity%2Fkolkata%2Fkolkata-doctor-rape-murder-case-live-updates-supreme-court-hearing-rg-kar-hospital-sandip-ghosh-accused-sanjay-roy-west-bengal-doctors-protest%2Fliveblog%2F113276298.cms&amp;sessionId=ce30e79d3bb687da3a63630007c5918c72c950e0&amp;siteScreenName=timesofindia&amp;theme=light&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716&amp;width=550px" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 550px; height: 671px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;" data-tweet-id="1834323646867013919"></iframe></div></div></div></div></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113307924"></i></div></div></div><div class="IDar7  p8L0K "><div class="fshNz">07:53 (IST) Sep 13<time datetime="2024-09-13T07:53:09+05:30"></time><meta content="2024-09-13T07:53:09+05:30"></div><div class="AimyF" id="post63"><p class="liveblogtextlist">Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: CBI quizzes TMC MLA Sudipto Roy and North Bengal lobby member</p></div><div class="sL5kN"><p><p class="liveblogtextlist">The CBI on Thursday questioned Trinamool Congress MLA Sudipto Roy, a prominent face of the 'North Bengal lobby' that has been accused in running a health syndicate after the rape and murder of the doctor of R G Kar Medical College. Roy is also the chairman of the Patient Welfare Committee (Rogi Kalyan Samiti) of the R G Kar Medical College. The agency also reached his nursing home at Belgharia. </p><a href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/rg-kar-rape-murder-cbi-quizzes-tmc-mla-sudipto-roy-and-north-bengal-lobby-member/articleshow/113302515.cms" index="63" frmappuse="1">Read more</a><br></p></div><div class="ham0T"><div data-socialtray="true" class="ePFGH"><i data-socialtray="true" class="JzZjH " data-socialclick="113307500"></i></div></div></div></div><div class="oMsH8 uN43u"><div class="DVenm">47<!-- --> More Updates</div><button>See More Updates</button></div><div class="art_synopsis lbg_synopsis btmsyn">The meeting between Mamata Banerjee and a doctors' delegation were called off after it reached a deadlock as the latter wanted livestreaming of the meet but the government disagreed.<br><br>Post Banerjee's visit to the protest site, the junior doctors wrote to the CM calling a welcome move and a "goodwill gesture." They also asked for another meeting in order to resolve the impasse between the state and the protesting medics.<br><br>Earlier today, Mamata Banerjee visited site outside Swasthya Bhawan in Salt Lake where junior doctors have been agitating.<br><br>Despite Mamata's arrival, chants for justice persisted at the protest site. The chief minister, holding the microphone for several minutes, struggled to begin her speech amid the ongoing chaos. She has been requesting permission to address the crowd.<br><br>I have come forward by leading the student movement, I have also struggled a lot in my life, I understand your struggle. I am not worried about my position. It rained all night yesterday, you were sitting here protesting, I was worried all night. After listening to your demands, I will study them. I do not run the government alone, I will definitely find a solution by studying your demands with senior officials. Whoever is found guilty will definitely be punished. I am asking for some time from you. The state government will not take any action against you (protesting doctors). I request you to return to work. All the work related to the development, infrastructure, security of the hospital has been started and will be done further: CM Mamata Banerjee<br></div></div><div class="Kwd3P"><div></div></div><div       var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
      xhr.open("GET", url, true);

          if (this.readyState == 4 && this.status == 200) {
              if (cb && typeof cb === 'function') {

I am not worried about my position. It rained all night yesterday, you were sitting here protesting, I was worried all night. After listening to your demands, I will study them. I do not run the government alone, I will definitely find a solution by studying your demands with senior officials. Whoever is found guilty will definitely be punished. I am asking for some time from you. The state government will not take any action against you (protesting doctors). I request you to return to work. one of the accused persons mentioned in the CBI's FIR. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Ffinancial-graft-probe-against-sandip-ghosh-ed-raids-in-chinar-park-tala-kalindi-in-kolkata\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302728.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Ffinancial-graft-probe-against-sandip-ghosh-ed-raids-in-chinar-park-tala-kalindi-in-kolkata\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302728.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Agitating doctors write to President Murmu, PM Modi seeking their intervention Agitating junior doctors in West Bengal have written to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, requesting their intervention in the RG Kar hospital impasse. Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. \\\"Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us,\\\" they wrote. One of the agitating doctors, Aniket Mahato, said that the letter was drafted earlier this month and sent on Thursday night.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Fissures in medical community over CM Mamata Banerjee meet cancellation The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago. Within minutes of the doctors backing out of the meeting after the govt refused to livestream it, several doctors took to social media to air their grievance against the move, with some calling it a wrong step. Others, however, felt that the govt could have allowed the livestreaming for the sake of breaking the stalemate. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-rape-murder-case-fissures-in-medical-community-over-cm-mamata-banerjee-meet-cancellation\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302449.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-rape-murder-case-fissures-in-medical-community-over-cm-mamata-banerjee-meet-cancellation\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302449.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Patients son threatens Kolkata hospital doctors with RG Kar rerun, held The son of a patient admitted to a private hospital on EM Bypass was arrested on Thursday for allegedly misbehaving with two doctors-a male and a female-and threatening them that \\\"an RG Kar would happen here\\\" on Wednesday. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-horror-patients-son-threatens-private-hospital-doctors-with-rg-kar-rerun-held\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302699.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-horror-patients-son-threatens-private-hospital-doctors-with-rg-kar-rerun-held\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302699.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Junior doctors continue their protests in Salt Lake Area of Kolkata Junior doctors in Kolkata continued their protests on Friday against the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College and Hospital. The protest was held near Swasthya Bhawan in the Salt Lake area of Kolkata city as doctors chanted slogans demanding justice for the victim.  On Thursday, West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee urged the protesting doctors to return to work, adding that she has no greed for her CM post, but is more concerned about justice for the RG Kar rape-murder victim and treatment for ordinary citizens.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: TMC's Derek O'Brien targets CBI over delay in charge sheet Trinamool Congress leader Derek O'Brien Friday questioned the delay in filing a charge sheet by the CBI in the RG Kar hospital rape-murder case. In a post on the social media platform X, the TMC leader demanded \\\"swift justice\\\". \\\"How long will the RG Kar victim's family have to wait for justice,\\\" O'Brien, the TMC's Parliamentary Party Leader in the Rajya Sabha, said in the post. The Supreme Court is monitoring the case, he said, adding, \\\"CBI has the accused &amp; all the evidence. Why is it not filing a chargesheet &amp; starting trial?\\\" \\\"We all want swift justice. Why is CBI delaying the trial? We need answers,\\\" O'Brien said.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: West Bengal health dept seeks data on medicos resuming work after September 9 Supreme Court order The state health department on Thursday asked principals of all medical colleges to send the number of junior doctors who have resumed duty after the Sept 9 Supreme Court order. I am not worried about my position. It rained all night yesterday, you were sitting here protesting, I was worried all night. After listening to your demands, I will study them. I do not run the government alone, I will definitely find a solution by studying your demands with senior officials. Whoever is found guilty will definitely be punished. I am asking for some time from you. The state government will not take any action against you (protesting doctors). I request you to return to work. one of the accused persons mentioned in the CBI's FIR. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Ffinancial-graft-probe-against-sandip-ghosh-ed-raids-in-chinar-park-tala-kalindi-in-kolkata\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302728.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Ffinancial-graft-probe-against-sandip-ghosh-ed-raids-in-chinar-park-tala-kalindi-in-kolkata\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302728.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Agitating doctors write to President Murmu, PM Modi seeking their intervention Agitating junior doctors in West Bengal have written to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, requesting their intervention in the RG Kar hospital impasse. Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. \\\"Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us,\\\" they wrote. One of the agitating doctors, Aniket Mahato, said that the letter was drafted earlier this month and sent on Thursday night.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Fissures in medical community over CM Mamata Banerjee meet cancellation The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago. Within minutes of the doctors backing out of the meeting after the govt refused to livestream it, several doctors took to social media to air their grievance against the move, with some calling it a wrong step. Others, however, felt that the govt could have allowed the livestreaming for the sake of breaking the stalemate. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-rape-murder-case-fissures-in-medical-community-over-cm-mamata-banerjee-meet-cancellation\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302449.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-rape-murder-case-fissures-in-medical-community-over-cm-mamata-banerjee-meet-cancellation\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302449.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Patients son threatens Kolkata hospital doctors with RG Kar rerun, held The son of a patient admitted to a private hospital on EM Bypass was arrested on Thursday for allegedly misbehaving with two doctors-a male and a female-and threatening them that \\\"an RG Kar would happen here\\\" on Wednesday. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-horror-patients-son-threatens-private-hospital-doctors-with-rg-kar-rerun-held\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302699.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-horror-patients-son-threatens-private-hospital-doctors-with-rg-kar-rerun-held\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302699.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Junior doctors continue their protests in Salt Lake Area of Kolkata Junior doctors in Kolkata continued their protests on Friday against the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College and Hospital. The protest was held near Swasthya Bhawan in the Salt Lake area of Kolkata city as doctors chanted slogans demanding justice for the victim.  On Thursday, West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee urged the protesting doctors to return to work, adding that she has no greed for her CM post, but is more concerned about justice for the RG Kar rape-murder victim and treatment for ordinary citizens.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: TMC's Derek O'Brien targets CBI over delay in charge sheet Trinamool Congress leader Derek O'Brien Friday questioned the delay in filing a charge sheet by the CBI in the RG Kar hospital rape-murder case. In a post on the social media platform X, the TMC leader demanded \\\"swift justice\\\". \\\"How long will the RG Kar victim's family have to wait for justice,\\\" O'Brien, the TMC's Parliamentary Party Leader in the Rajya Sabha, said in the post. The Supreme Court is monitoring the case, he said, adding, \\\"CBI has the accused &amp; all the evidence. Why is it not filing a chargesheet &amp; starting trial?\\\" \\\"We all want swift justice. Why is CBI delaying the trial? We need answers,\\\" O'Brien said.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: West Bengal health dept seeks data on medicos resuming work after September 9 Supreme Court order The state health department on Thursday asked principals of all medical colleges to send the number of junior doctors who have resumed duty after the Sept 9 Supreme Court order. Though the directive from the director of medical education (DME) sought the report by afternoon, many were still compiling the data till late at night.\u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-doctor-rape-murder-how-many-junior-doctors-back-at-work-dme-asks-hospitals\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302400.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-doctor-rape-murder-how-many-junior-doctors-back-at-work-dme-asks-hospitals\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302400.cms\\\"\u003E Read more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: TMC MP calls agitating medicos 'unfit to become doctors' Senior TMC MP Kalyan Banerjee on Thursday criticised junior doctors in West Bengal for their ongoing strike, calling them \\\"inhumane and unfit to become doctors.\\\" The MP urged the state government to ensure that they are not allowed to appear for their final exams. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-protest-tmc-mp-calls-agitating-medicos-unfit-to-become-doctors\u002Farticleshow\u002F113311507.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-protest-tmc-mp-calls-agitating-medicos-unfit-to-become-doctors\u002Farticleshow\u002F113311507.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Why Sanjay Roys dental impression, mouth swab could be crucial evidence in RG Kar doctors rape-murder The CBI on Tuesday night collected dental impression of Sanjay Roy, arrested for the rape and murder of the 31-year-old PGT doctor at RG Kar. Roy, lodged at Presidency Correctional Home, was again questioned on Wednesday for three-and-a-half hours. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-pgt-doctor-rape-murder-case-cbi-collects-sanjay-roys-dental-impression-mouth-swab\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302576.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-pgt-doctor-rape-murder-case-cbi-collects-sanjay-roys-dental-impression-mouth-swab\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302576.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Lawyer of accused Sanjay Roy questions autopsy Sanjay Roy's lawyer Kabita Sarkar, who has expressed doubts over the post-mortem process of the RG Kar victim, is likely to question in court the process of the autopsy and preservation of fluids retrieved by the police. Roy is the only person, who has so far been arrested for the rape and murder of the RG Kar doctor. \u003Ca href=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-doctor-case-lawyer-of-accused-sanjay-roy-questions-autopsy\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302660.cms\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" title=\\\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-doctor-case-lawyer-of-accused-sanjay-roy-questions-autopsy\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302660.cms\\\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Junior doctors hold a protest for third night in a row at Swasthya Bhawan in Kolkata's Salt Lake area .Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: CBI quizzes TMC MLA Sudipto Roy and North Bengal lobby member The CBI on Thursday questioned Trinamool Congress MLA Sudipto Roy, a prominent face of the 'North Bengal lobby' that has been accused in running a health syndicate after the rape and murder of the doctor of R G Kar Medical College. Roy is also the chairman of the Patient Welfare Committee (Rogi Kalyan Samiti) of the R G Kar Medical College. Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. \"Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us,\" they wrote. Just think about the parents of RG Kar MCH rape and murder victims parents, who were made to wait for hours to see their dead daughters face. What about 840 hours of Junior Doctors? Why can't Mamata Banerjee agree to a live telecast or at least a two-way video recording? What is the logic of providing the recording two days later? The Supreme Court is to hear the matter four days later. Hence, the logic that the matter is subjudice is a hogwash. What is the WB Govt planning to do with the video?\" Amit Malviya said in a post on X.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E\"Mamata Banerjee claims that some people are playing politics. Really? Isn't it true that a journalist (who holds a position in WB Govt while serving as editor of a channel) was sent to mediate? The acting DGP of West Bengal Police was constantly confabulating with him to steer the situation. What was he doing in the negotiations, if not politicking? Isn't it true that some ultra Left elements, who are agents of the TMC, held meeting with a political consulting firm, working for the TMC? Isn't it true that they were given the task of seeding division in the ranks of protesting doctors? Isn't this ultra Left gang the same people, who are scribbling and damaging walls of BJPs State HQ, just 50 meters away from the doctors protest site? Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. \"Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us,\" they wrote. One of the agitating doctors, Aniket Mahato, said that the letter was drafted earlier this month and sent on Thursday night.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E","emcontent":null,"imgsize":"","timestamp":1726219943,"metainfo":{"NoindexAndNofollow":"1"}},{"type":"t","msid":"113319541","subtype":"","title":"Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Fissures in medical community over CM Mamata Banerjee meet cancellation","overridelink":"","smalldesc":"The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago. Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. \"Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us,\" they wrote. One of the agitating doctors, Aniket Mahato, said that the letter was drafted earlier this month and sent on Thursday night.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E","emcontent":null,"imgsize":"","timestamp":1726219943,"metainfo":{"NoindexAndNofollow":"1"}},{"type":"t","msid":"113319541","subtype":"","title":"Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Fissures in medical community over CM Mamata Banerjee meet cancellation","overridelink":"","smalldesc":"The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago. Within minutes of the doctors backing out of the meeting after the govt refused to livestream it, several doctors took to social media to air their grievance against the move, with some calling it a wrong step. Others, however, felt that the govt could have allowed the livestreaming for the sake of breaking the stalemate. \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-rape-murder-case-fissures-in-medical-community-over-cm-mamata-banerjee-meet-cancellation\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302449.cms\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimesofindia.indiatimes.com\u002Fcity\u002Fkolkata\u002Fkolkata-rape-murder-case-fissures-in-medical-community-over-cm-mamata-banerjee-meet-cancellation\u002Farticleshow\u002F113302449.cms\"\u003ERead more\u003C\u002Fa\u003E","emcontent":null,"imgsize":"","timestamp":1726217695,"metainfo":{"NoindexAndNofollow":"1"},"smalldescv2":["The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago. Within minutes of the doctors backing out of the meeting after the govt refused to livestream it, several doctors took to social media to air their grievance against the move, with some calling it a wrong step. Others, however, felt that the govt could have allowed the livestreaming for the sake of breaking the stalemate. Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. \"Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us,\" they wrote. One of the agitating doctors, Aniket Mahato, said that the letter was drafted earlier this month and sent on Thursday night.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E","emcontent":null,"imgsize":"","timestamp":1726219943,"metainfo":{"NoindexAndNofollow":"1"}},{"type":"t","msid":"113319541","subtype":"","title":"Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Fissures in medical community over CM Mamata Banerjee meet cancellation","overridelink":"","smalldesc":"The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago.     setCookieonetrust('optout', '0', window.location.host, 365);
    if (window.localStorage) {
        window.localStorage.setItem('ccpaGdprPopupShown', '1');
    }

}

function onRejectOnetrust() {
    setCookieonetrust('optout', '1', window.location.host, 365);
    if (window.localStorage) {
        window.localStorage.setItem('ccpaGdprPopupShown', '1');
    }
}
var setCookieonetrust = function(name, value, domainName, days) {
    if (!!domainName) {
        var domain = ";domain=" + domainName;
    }
    if (!!days) {
        //Below variable is one day time in mili seconds.
        var _oneDayinMS = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000;
        var d = new Date();
        d.setTime(d.getTime() + (days * _oneDayinMS));
        var expires = ";expires=" + d.toUTCString();
    }
    document.cookie = name + "=" + value + ((expires) ? expires : '') + ((domain) ? domain : '') + ";path=/";
}

function attachOnetrustListener() {
    if (window.onetrustEventsAttached) {
        return;
    }
    const onetrustSDK = document.querySelector("#onetrust-consent-sdk");
    if (onetrustSDK) {
        const acceptBtn = onetrustSDK.querySelector("#onetrust-banner-sdk #onetrust-accept-btn-handler");
        const closeBtn = onetrustSDK.querySelector("#onetrust-banner-sdk .onetrust-close-btn-handler");
        const rejectAllBtn = onetrustSDK.querySelector("#onetrust-banner-sdk #onetrust-reject-all-handler");
        // Adding events if acceptBtn is present then related buttons also be presented.
        if (acceptBtn) {
            acceptBtn.addEventListener("click", onAcceptOnetrust);
        }
        if (closeBtn) {
            closeBtn.addEventListener("click", onRejectOnetrust);
        }
        if (rejectAllBtn) {
            rejectAllBtn.addEventListener("click", onRejectOnetrust);
        }
        window.onetrustEventsAttached = true;
        const onetrustPCSDK = onetrustSDK.querySelector("#onetrust-pc-sdk");
        if (!onetrustPCSDK) {
            return;
        }
        const allowBtn = onetrustPCSDK.querySelector("#accept-recommended-btn-handler");
        const rejectBtn = onetrustPCSDK.querySelector(".ot-pc-refuse-all-handler");
        const confirmChoiceBtn = onetrustPCSDK.querySelector(".save-preference-btn-handler");
        // Adding events if allowBtn is present then related buttons also be presented.
        if (allowBtn) {
            allowBtn.addEventListener("click", onAcceptOnetrust);
        }
        if (confirmChoiceBtn) {
            confirmChoiceBtn.addEventListener("click", onAcceptOnetrust);
        }
        if (rejectBtn) {
            rejectBtn.addEventListener("click", onRejectOnetrust);
        }
    }
}

function OptanonWrapper() {
    attachOnetrustListener();
}</script><script type="text/javascript">window.TimesApps = window.TimesApps || {};
var TimesApps = window.TimesApps || {};
TimesApps.popupManagerFullyInitilizedEvent = new CustomEvent('popup_manager_ready', {
    detail: { message: 'popup_manager_ready' }
});
TimesApps.popupManger2 = function popupManagerHigherOrderPopups() {
    window.TimesApps = window.TimesApps || {};
    var TimesApps = window.TimesApps || {};
    const debugLogs = function(str1, str2, str3) {
      if (
        typeof window === 'object' &&
        window.location.search &&
        window.location.search.indexOf('debug') > -1 &&
        window.console
      ) {
        console.log(str1, str2, str3);
      }
    };
    TimesApps.PopUpList = {};
    TimesApps.PopupV2 = function(name, showPopCallback , priority, data) {
      const dataObj = data || {};
      this.id = name;
      this.lastShownTimeStamp = dataObj.lastShownTimeStamp
        ? dataObj.lastShownTimeStamp
        : null;
      this.showPopCallback = showPopCallback;
      this.priority = priority;
      // this.status;
      this.userActionStatus = null;
      this.retryDone = 0;
      this.shown = 0;
      // this.forceRepeat = dataObj.forceRepeat;
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.showPopCallback = function() {
      return this.showPopCallback();
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.getDetailsPopUp = function() {
      return { ...this };
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.onReadyCallback = function(status) {
      this.ready = status;
      if (status === 3) {
        this.setStatus(false);
      }
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.isReady = function() {
      return this.ready;
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.onShowCallback = function(status) {
      this.shown = status;
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.getStatus = function() {
      return this.status;
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.setStatus = function(status) {
      this.status = status || false;
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.getLastShownTime = function() {
      return this.lastShownTimeStamp;
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopupV2.prototype.onUserActionCallback = function(status) {
      this.userActionStatus = status;
    };
  
    TimesApps.PopUpV2Manager = (function() {
      /*
          1. Register overlay
          2. Decide overlay priority
          3. show overlay
  
  
          Register overlay
              - registerOverlay
                  - return onReadyCallback
                  - all popup's call onReadyCallback to mark status, they are ready to be called
              - read priority from config
              - create priority queue
  
          Decide overlay priority
              - read priority queue
              - call if 1st is ready
                      - if status OK  - call
                      - else if not needed to be called, call Next
              -
  
          Show overlay
              - save state in Localstorage
                  - show - true/false
                  - timestamp
  
  
          Config
              - popup list
              - priority for each
              - show frequency
      */
  
      const config = {
        browserStorageKey: 'popUpManagerHigherOrderPopUps',
      };
  
      const constants = {
        HRS_IN_DAY: 24,
        MINS_IN_HR: 60,
        SEC_IN_MIN: 60,
        MilliSEC_IN_SEC: 1000,
      };
  
      const fn = {
        _docReady(forcefully = false) {
          (function() {
            const referrer = document.referrer;
            try {
              if(forcefully) {
                const data1 = JSON.parse(
                  localStorage.getItem(config.browserStorageKey),
                );
                if (data1.actualData &&
                  Array.isArray(data1.actualData) &&
                  data1.actualData.length > 0 &&
                  (TimesApps.PopUpList[data1.actualData[0].name] &&
                  TimesApps.PopUpList[data1.actualData[0].name].getDetailsPopUp()?.id === 'interstitial')){
                    let pageViewsAfterGDPR = parseInt(localStorage.getItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR'), 10);
                    if (!pageViewsAfterGDPR && isNaN(pageViewsAfterGDPR)) {
                        pageViewsAfterGDPR = 0;
                    }
                    localStorage.setItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR', pageViewsAfterGDPR + data1.burninterval);
                    return;
                  }
              }
              if (window.localStorage && window.toi_client_side_settings) {
                  if(window.localStorage && localStorage.getItem("ccpaGdprPopupShown") === '1'){
                      let pageViewsAfterGDPR = parseInt(localStorage.getItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR'), 10);
                          if (!pageViewsAfterGDPR && isNaN(pageViewsAfterGDPR)) {
                              pageViewsAfterGDPR = 0;
                          }
                          localStorage.setItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR', pageViewsAfterGDPR + 1);
                      }
                let pageViews =
                  localStorage.getItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR') &&
                  parseInt(localStorage.getItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR'), 10);
                let data = JSON.parse(
                  localStorage.getItem(config.browserStorageKey),
                );
                fn._saveAndMakeReady(data, pageViews);
                if (
                  data &&
                  Date.now() - data.time >
                  data.burntime * constants.SEC_IN_MIN * constants.MilliSEC_IN_SEC
                ) {
                  localStorage.removeItem(config.browserStorageKey);
                  localStorage.setItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR', 1);
                  pageViews = parseInt(localStorage.getItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR'), 10);
                  data = null;
                }
                if (!data) {
                  window.toi_client_side_settings.time = Date.now();
                  data = window.toi_client_side_settings;
                  data.actualData = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(data.priority));
                  data.actualData.sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
                  if (!(localStorage.getItem("autoCcpaGdprPopupShown"))){
                    data.nextPageView = 1 + data.burninterval;
                  } else {
                    data.nextPageView = 1;
                  }
                  fn._saveAndMakeReady(data, pageViews);
                }
                config.burninterval = data.burninterval;
                config.burntime = data.burntime;
                config.data = data;
                if (config.data.actualData &&
                  Array.isArray(config.data.actualData) &&
                  config.data.actualData.length > 0) {
                  if(config.data.nextPageView - (config.burninterval + 1) === pageViews || forcefully){
                    if (!forcefully){
                      document.addEventListener('popup_manager_ready', function(event) {
                        if (!(TimesApps.PopUpList[config.data.actualData[0].name] && config.data.actualData[0].status === 1)) {
                          return fn._docReady(true);
                        }
                        TimesApps.PopUpList[config.data.actualData[0].name].showPopCallback()
                      });
                    } else {
                      if (!(TimesApps.PopUpList[config.data.actualData[0].name] && config.data.actualData[0].status === 1)) {
                        return fn._docReady(true);
                      }
                      TimesApps.PopUpList[config.data.actualData[0].name].showPopCallback()
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            } catch(ex){
              console.log(ex, "Popup manager Error")
            }
          })();
        },
        _init() {
          console.log('Pop up manager is initialtized');
          if(Array.isArray(window.TimesApps.PopUpV2Manager.regiteredPopup) && window.TimesApps.PopUpV2Manager.regiteredPopup.length > 0){
              window.TimesApps.PopUpV2Manager.regiteredPopup.forEach(function(cbfn){
                  if(typeof cbfn === 'function'){
                      cbfn()
                  }
              })
          }
        },
        _saveAndMakeReady(data, pageViews) {
          if(data?.actualData &&
            Array.isArray(data?.actualData) &&
            data.actualData.length > 0 && pageViews && pageViews > 0){
            // eslint-disable-next-line guard-for-in, no-restricted-syntax
            data.actualData.some((singleData, index) => {
                if (singleData.status === 1) {
                    const shouldRepeat = singleData.forceRepeat || singleData.repeat;
                    if (shouldRepeat) {
                        singleData.priority = data.actualData[data.actualData.length - 1].priority + 1;
                        singleData.status = 0;
                        data.actualData.push(singleData);
                    }
                    data.actualData.shift();
                }
                if(data.actualData && Array.isArray(data.actualData) && data.actualData.length > 0){
                  singleData = data.actualData[0];
                  if (data.nextPageView === pageViews) {
                      singleData.status = 1;
                      data.nextPageView = pageViews + data.burninterval + 1;
                      return true;
                  }
                }
            });
            localStorage.setItem(config.browserStorageKey, JSON.stringify(data));
          }
        },
        _registerPopUp(id, callBack) {
          let callbacks = {};
          try{
            const popUp = fn._createPopUpObject(id, callBack);
            if (!popUp) return null;
            callbacks = {
              onReadyCallback: fn._onReadyCallback.bind(popUp),
              onShowCallback: fn._onShowCallback.bind(popUp),
              onUserActionCallback: popUp.onUserActionCallback,
              getDetail: fn._getDetails.bind(popUp),
            };
            popUp.callbacks = callbacks;
            TimesApps.PopUpList[id] = popUp;
            let data = JSON.parse(
              localStorage.getItem(config.browserStorageKey),
            );
            let actualData = Array.isArray(data.actualData) && data.actualData.length > 0 ? data.actualData.map((d)=> d.name).sort() : [];
            let popupList = Object.keys(TimesApps.PopUpList).sort();
            if (actualData.join() === popupList.join()){
              document.dispatchEvent(TimesApps.popupManagerFullyInitilizedEvent);
            }
          } catch (err) {}
          return callbacks;
        },
        _getDetails(){
            return this.getDetailsPopUp();
        },
        _onReadyCallback(status) {
          this.onReadyCallback(status);
        },
        _onShowCallback(status) {
            /*
             * popup displayed
             */
            debugLogs('*** onShowCallback', this, status);
            this.onShowCallback(status);
            fn._setStatusInStorage(this, status);
          },
          _setStatusInStorage(obj, status) {
            const data = fn._getStatusFromStorage();
            const index = fn._getIndex(data.actualData, obj.id);
            data.actualData[index].lastShownTimeStamp = Date.now();
            data.actualData[index].shown = status;
            data.actualData[index].atPageView = parseInt(
                localStorage.getItem('pageViewsAfterGDPR'),
                10,
            )
            if( data?.actualData && Array.isArray(data?.actualData) && data?.actualData.length){
              data.actualData.shift();
              fn._setStatusFromStorage(data);
            }
            if (status === false) {
              fn._docReady(true);
            }
          },
          _getIndex(data, named) {
            let index = -1;
            if(data){
                Object.keys(data).forEach((key, i) => {
                    if (data[key].name === named) {
                        index = i;
                    }
                });
            }
            return index;
          },
        _createPopUpObject(id, showCallback = null) {
            const popUpdata = {};
            const data = fn._getStatusFromStorage();
            if (!(data && data.actualData)){
                return null;
            }
            const { priority, lastShownTimeStamp, name } = data.actualData.find(
              item => item.name === id,
            ) || {};
            if (name){
              popUpdata.lastShownTimeStamp = lastShownTimeStamp;
              return new TimesApps.PopupV2(name, showCallback, priority, popUpdata);
            }
        },
        _isPopuManagerRunningInSession() {
          if (localStorage.getItem("pageViewsAfterGDPR") && fn._getStatusFromStorage()) return true;
          return false;
        },
        _setStatusFromStorage(data) {
            localStorage.setItem(config.browserStorageKey, JSON.stringify(data));
        },
        _getStatusFromStorage() {
          const jsonData = localStorage.getItem(config.browserStorageKey);
          let data;
  
          try {
            data = JSON.parse(jsonData) || {};
          } catch (e) {
            data = null;
            //console.log('popupManager, JSON error');
          }

          return data;
        },
      };

      fn._docReady();
      const regiteredPopup = window.TimesApps.PopUpV2Manager.cmd || [];
      setTimeout(()=>{
        fn._init();
      },100)

      const api = {
        cmd: {
            push: function(callback){
                if(typeof callback === 'function'){
                    callback();
                }
            }
        },
        regiteredPopup: regiteredPopup,
        register(id, showCallback) {
          return fn._registerPopUp(id, showCallback);
        },
        isPopuMangerRunning() {
          return fn._isPopuManagerRunningInSession();
        },
        reloadPopupManager(forcefully) {
          return fn._docReady(forcefully);
        },
      };

      return api;
    })();
  }; </script><script type="text/javascript">function ccaudjs() {
    var toiId = '2658:3';
    var etimesId = '65615:2608';

          dsmi = "dsmi=" + cookie + "&";

    gtmdmp.defer = true;

    s.parentNode.insertBefore(gtmdmp, s)
    setTimeout(function(){dumpAudsToLocalStorage()},5000);
  }
  function dumpAudsToLocalStorage() {
    if(typeof localStorage != "undefined" && typeof colaud != "undefined" && colaud.aud != ""){
      localStorage.setItem('colaud', colaud.aud);
    }
  }

!(function(f, b, e, v, n, t, s) {
    function loadFBEvents(isFBCampaignActive) {
      if (!isFBCampaignActive) {
        return;
      }
      (function(f, b, e, v, n, t, s) {
        if (f.fbq) return;
        n = f.fbq = function() {
          n.callMethod ? n.callMethod(...arguments) : n.queue.push(arguments);
        };
        if (!f._fbq) f._fbq = n;
        n.push = n;
        n.loaded = !0;
        n.version = '2.0';
        n.queue = [];
        t = b.createElement(e);
        t.async = !0;
        t.defer = !0;
        t.src = v;
        s = b.getElementsByTagName(e)[0];
        s.parentNode.insertBefore(t, s);
      })(f, b, e, 'https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/fbevents.js', n, t, s);
      fbq('init', '593671331875494');
      fbq('track', 'PageView');
    };

    function loadGtagEvents(isGoogleCampaignActive) {
      if (!isGoogleCampaignActive) {
        return;
      }
      var id = document.getElementById('toi-plus-google-campaign');
      if (id) {
        return;
      }
      (function(f, b, e, v, n, t, s) {
        t = b.createElement(e);
        t.async = !0;
        t.defer = !0;
        t.src = v;
        t.id = 'toi-plus-google-campaign';
        s = b.getElementsByTagName(e)[0];
        s.parentNode.insertBefore(t, s);
      })(f, b, e, 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=AW-877820074', n, t, s);
    };

                    toi_user_subscription_status : prime_user_status,
                    toi_homepage_variant_status: viwedVariant
                        });
                }

         if (w._sva && w._sva.setVisitorTraits) {
                    setAttributes();
                } else {

          s.async = true;
          var e = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
          e.parentNode.insertBefore(s, e);
        })(window);
      }

    }

    window._delayedResourcesLoaded = false;
    var _callDelayedResourcesImmediately = false || false || false || false;

    function loadStateJSON(src, callOnLoad) {
      fetch(src)
        .then(response => {
          if (!response.ok) {
            throw new Error('Network response was not ok');
          }
          return response.json();
        })
        .then(data => {
          window.App = data;
          callOnLoad();
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was a problem with the fetch operation:', error);
        });
    }
    
    function loadResources() {
        if(!false && typeof loadCSS === 'function') {
          _stylechunks.forEach(function(src) {
            loadCSS(src);
          });
        }
        var callOnBrowserIdle = function (callback) {
            if(callback && typeof callback === 'function'){
              if (typeof window.requestIdleCallback === "function") {
                window.requestIdleCallback(callback);
              } else {
                setTimeout(callback,0)
              }
            }
        };

        function loadJs(src) {
          var script = document.createElement('script');
          script.type = "text/javascript";
          script.src = src;
          script.async = true;
          script.defer = true;
          if(src && src.includes('_es6_module')) {
              script.type = "module";
            } else if(!(src && (src.includes('geoapi')))) {
              script.noModule = true;
            }
          document.body.appendChild(script);
        }  
        _chunks.forEach(function(src) {
          setTimeout(function(){
              loadJs(src)
            },0)
          });

        if(typeof window !== 'undefined' && window.TimesApps) {
            var functionsToCall = ["ResetFirstFoldScroll", "initCLSHandling"];
            var functionsToCallWhenIdle = [
              "loadGrowthRXsdk",
              "popupManger2", 
              "showInterstitial",
              "loadScriptsOnceAdsReady",
              "loadTpSdk",
              "toiPlusEvents"
            ];
            if(false) {
              functionsToCallWhenIdle = [
                "loadScriptsOnceAdsReady",
              ];
            }
            var callTimesAppsFn = function (fnName, useIdleCallback) {
              if (typeof window.TimesApps[fnName] === "function") {
                if (useIdleCallback) {
                  callOnBrowserIdle(window.TimesApps[fnName]); 
                } else {
                  window.TimesApps[fnName]();
                }
              }
            };
            functionsToCall.forEach(function (fn) {
                callTimesAppsFn(fn, false);
            });
            functionsToCallWhenIdle.forEach(function (fn) {
                callTimesAppsFn(fn, true);
            });
        }
    }

    window._loadDelayedResources = function(){
      // console.log('Document Ready State', document.readyState);
      if (!_delayedResourcesLoaded && typeof window !== 'undefined') {
        _delayedResourcesLoaded = true;
        debugLogs('########## Calling _loadDelayedResources in React App: ', (performance.now()/1000).toFixed(2)+'seconds');
        if(false) {
          loadStateJSON("", loadResources);
        } else {
          loadResources();
        }
        
      }
    }

    if(_callDelayedResourcesImmediately){
      // TODO: Trigger the event for delayed load in ga4
      window._loadDelayedResources();
    }
    else {
      // Commented due to ads impacted due to it.
      // document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => {
      //   setTimeout(window._loadDelayedResources, 0);
      // });
      setTimeout(() => {
        debugLogs('########## Calling _loadDelayedResources via settimeout - fail fallback: ', (performance.now()/1000).toFixed(2)+'seconds');
        window._loadDelayedResources();
        // TODO: Trigger the event for delayed load in ga4
      }, 6000);
    }

(function() {
  if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
    window._dfpObj = window._dfpObj || {};
    window._dfpObj.displayShieldExecuted = false;
    window._dfpObj.displayBlkrEnabled = null;

    window._dfpObj.setCookie = function(name, value, minutes) {
      var date = new Date();
      date.setTime(date.getTime() + minutes * 60 * 1000);
      document.cookie =
        name +
        '=' +
        value +
        ';expires=' +
        date.toUTCString() +
        ';path=/;domain=.' +
        document.domain;
    };
    window._dfpObj.getCookie = function(cname) {
      var name = cname + '=';
      var ca = document.cookie.split(';');
      for (var i = 0; i < ca.length; i++) {
        var c = ca[i];
        while (c.charAt(0) == ' ') {
          c = c.substring(1);
        }
        if (c.indexOf(name) == 0) {
          return c.substring(name.length, c.length);
        }
      }
      return '';
    };

    window._dfpObj.displayShield = function() {
      var script = document.createElement('script');
      script.type = 'text/javascript';

    window._dfpObj.prebidAvailable = function() {
      setTimeout(function() {
        if (
          (window.pbjs && typeof window.pbjs.requestBids === 'function') ||
          (window.PWT && typeof window.PWT.requestBids === 'function')
        )
          return;
        window.DisplayBlkrDetected('prebidBlocked');
      }, 4000);
    };
    window.DisplayBlkrDetected = function(type) {
      window._dfpObj.displayBlkrEnabled = window._dfpObj.getCookie('displayRender')
        ? window._dfpObj.getCookie('displayRender')
        : null;
      if (type === 'prebidBlocked') window._dfpObj.displayBlkrEnabled = 0;
      if (
        (parseInt(window._dfpObj.displayBlkrEnabled) === 0 ||
          window.prebidBlocked) &&
        !window._dfpObj.displayShieldExecuted
      ) {
        window._dfpObj.setCookie('displayRender', 0, 24 * 60 * 30);
        window._dfpObj.displayShield();
        window._dfpObj.displayShieldExecuted = true;
      } else {
        window._dfpObj.prebidAvailable();
      }
    };
    window.DisplayBlkrDetected('default');
    window._dfpObj.displayBlkrRender = true;
    window.googletag.cmd.push(function() {
      window.googletag
        .pubads()
        .addEventListener('slotRenderEnded', function(event) {
          if (window._dfpObj.displayBlkrRender && event.isEmpty) {
            window._dfpObj.setCookie('displayRender', 0, 24 * 60 * 30);
            window._dfpObj.displayBlkrRender = false;
          }
          if (!event.isEmpty)
            window._dfpObj.setCookie('displayRender', 1, 24 * 60 * 30);
        });
    });
  }

one of the accused persons mentioned in the CBI's FIR. <a href=\"https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/financial-graft-probe-against-sandip-ghosh-ed-raids-in-chinar-park-tala-kalindi-in-kolkata/articleshow/113302728.cms\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/financial-graft-probe-against-sandip-ghosh-ed-raids-in-chinar-park-tala-kalindi-in-kolkata/articleshow/113302728.cms\">Read more</a>.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Agitating doctors write to President Murmu, PM Modi seeking their intervention Agitating junior doctors in West Bengal have written to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, requesting their intervention in the RG Kar hospital impasse. Copies of the four-page letter written by the West Bengal Junior Doctors' Front were also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar and Union Health Minister JP Nadda. A post-graduate trainee was raped and murdered in state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. Junior doctors have been on 'cease work' since then. \"Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us,\" they wrote. One of the agitating doctors, Aniket Mahato, said that the letter was drafted earlier this month and sent on Thursday night.<br/>.Kolkata Doctor Rape-Murder Case: Fissures in medical community over CM Mamata Banerjee meet cancellation The last-minute cancellation of the junior doctors' meeting with chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday evening exposed fissures in the city's medical community for the first time since they closed ranks to fight for justice over a month ago. Within minutes of the doctors backing out of the meeting after the govt refused to livestream it, several doctors took to social media to air their grievance against the move, with some calling it a wrong step. id="close-pc-btn-handler" class="ot-close-icon" aria-label="Close" style="background-image: url(&quot;https://cdn.cookielaw.org/logos/static/ot_close.svg&quot;);"></button></div></div></div><!-- content --><!-- Groups / Sub groups with cookies --><div id="ot-pc-content" class="ot-pc-scrollbar ot-sdk-row"><div class="ot-optout-signal ot-hide"><div class="ot-optout-icon"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path class="ot-floating-button__svg-fill" d="M14.588 0l.445.328c1.807 1.303 3.961 2.533 6.461 3.688 2.015.93 4.576 1.746 7.682 2.446 0 14.178-4.73 24.133-14.19
